asked the Prime Minister, Minister of Internal Administration and Deputy Minister of Defence, Public Security, Law and Order : (a) Will he inform this House,
(i) the number of families received the Samurdhi subsistence from the Government as at 30th June of every year from 2004 to 2007 in the Matara District; and

(ii) the categories of the above families according to the amount they received? (b) Will he state, (i) the value of inflation for the years 2004, 2005, 2006 and 2007; (ii) the value in real terms they received in the subsequent years up to 2007 when discount the inflation taking 2004 as a base year; (iii) whether there is a drastic drop in the purchasing power of the Samurdhi recipients owing to the mishandling of the economy resulting a high inflation?

asked the Prime Minister, Minister of Internal Admini-stration, and Deputy Minister of Defence, Public Security, Law and Order,: (a) Will he inform this House (i) the number of families received the Samurdhi subsistence from the Government as at 30th June of every year from 2004 to 2007 in the Polonnaruwa District; and (ii) the categories of the above families according to the amount they received? (b) Will he state (i) the value of inflation for the years 2004, 2005, 2006 and 2007; (ii) the value in real terms they received in the sub-sequent years up to 2007 when discount the inflation taking 2004 as a base year; (iii) whether there is a drastic drop in the purchasing power of the Samurdhi recipients owing to the mishandling of the economy resulting a high inflation? (c) If not, why?

() , ? asked the Prime Minister, Minister of Internal Admini-stration, and Deputy Minister of Defence, Public Security, Law and Order, (a) Will he inform this House (i) the number of families received the Samurdhi subsistence from the Government as at 30th June of every year from 2004 to 2007 in the Nuwara-Eliya District; and
(ii) the categories of the above families according to the amount they received? (b) Will he state

(i) the value of inflation for the years 2004, 2005, 2006 and 2007; (ii) the value in real terms they received in the sub-sequent years up to 2007 when discount the inflation taking 2004 as a base year; (iii) whether there is a drastic drop in the purchasing power of the Samurdhi recipients owing to the mishandling of the economy resulting a high inflation?

: , : MINISTRY OF RELIGIOUS AFFAIRS AND MORAL UPLIFTMENT : RECRUITMENT

asked the Prime Minister, Minister of Internal Administration and Deputy Minister of Defence, Public Security, Law and Order : (a) Will he inform this House whether a new batch of employees has been recruited, for the Ministry of Religious Affairs and Moral Upliftment or departments, corporations or other institutions that come under it in the year 2007? (b) Will he submit to this House,
(i) separately, the number that has been recruited for each institution if such a batch has been recruited;
(ii) separately, the number that has been recruited for each post; and
(iii) separately, the number that has been confirmed in service and the number of graduates out of the aforesaid batch of employees? (c) If not, why?

asked the Minister of Transport, (1) (a) Is he aware that (i) under Section 33(3) of part 5 of Sri Lanka Transport Board Act, No.27 of 2005, the cluster bus companies which were scattered all over the Island by then were legally converted into SLTB by a Gazette Extraordinary dated 19.10.2005; and (ii) under Section 2 of Act, No.23 of 1987 Conversion of Government Corporations or Government owned Undertakings into Public Companies, 49 percent of the shares of the aforesaid company were given to the employees and the remaining 51 percent of the shares are being kept under the government? (b) Will he admit that under Section 2 of the aforesaid Act, those employees are entitled to the ownership of the 49 percent of the shares which were owned by the former shareholders and the present shareholders? (c) The aforesaid cluster bus companies were amalgamated as Sri Lanka Transport Board under Sri Lanka Transport Board Act, No.27 of 2005,
hence will he take measures to repay the value of the shares that were given to the employees when converting it to a public company? (d) if so, when? (e) If not, why?

asked the Prime Minister, Minister of Internal Administration and Deputy Minister of Defence, Public Security, Law and Order : (a) Is he aware that 3 vehicles of PRADO make bearing the registration numbers 65-1986, 65-1988 and 65-1990 which belonged to the transport section of the Bank of Ceylon are missing? (b) Will he inform this House (i) whether any complaints have been made to the Police regarding these vehicles; (ii) the action that has been taken to get the vehicles bearing the aforesaid registration numbers back to the transport section of the Bank of Ceylon; and

(iii) if these vehicles are used by any outside persons, whether legal action has been taken against them? (c) Will he state (i) separately, the names and designations of the persons who have been assigned with these three vehicles officially; and (ii) whether the aforesaid persons have informed the relevant transport section of this matter? (d) If not, why?

I would like to say that this Question is directed to the Hon. Prime Minister. The Prime Minister is present in the House. When the Prime Minister is in the House, at least he must have the country to tell the Member asking the question that the Chief Government Whip will answer the Question, It is a practice. It is all right if the relevant Member is not here. It is a basic country.

asked the Minister of Urban Development and Sacred Area Development :
(a) Is he aware that 36 trainees are serving in the Urban Development Authority under the computer training scheme?
(i) these trainees have the maximum qualifications required for the relevant training;
(ii) the trainees have undergone training continuously for a period exceeding two years as their service has been extended every 03 months during the period of training; and
(iii) there are trainees who have received training for more than 05 years among them?

(i) As vacancies exist in the permanent cadre of the Urban Development Authority, will he take action to appoint these trainees who have undergone training continuously for several years to the aforesaid vacancies on a permanent basis?
(ii) If so, the date from which they will be appointed?

( - - ) (The Hon. Palitha Range Bandara on behalf (The Hon. Ranjith Aluvihare) (1) : () (i) ; (ii) ; ? () (i) ; (ii) , ; (iii) ;

() , ? asked the Minister of Cultural Affairs and National Heritage,(1) (a) Will he inform this House (i) the names of the foreign countries which the Minister visited since the Minister of Cultural Affairs and National Heritage was appointed to the aforesaid office up to now; and (ii) the official and personal foreign visits separately, out of the aforesaid foreign visits?

(b) Will he submit to this House separately in respect of each visit (i) the names and designations of the officials who accompanied him; (ii) if any officers of his personal staff accompanied him their names and designations; (iii) the names of the airline and the class in which the Minister and the other officials travelled; and (iv) the amount of money spent by the state on the Minister and the officials for the aforesaid visits to foreign countries?
(c) Will he state separately, in respect of each visit, the foreign aid, foreign loans, projects or other benefits received by the country as a result of these visits? (d) If not, why?

asked the Prime Minister, Minister of Internal Admini-stration, and Deputy Minister of Defence, Public Security, Law and Order : (a) Will he inform this House (i) the basic qualifications that the Samurdhi ani-mators had to possess when they were recruited in 1995; and (ii) the number of Samurdhi animators that were recruited? (b) Will he state (i) whether a group of officers were absorbed to the Department of Agriculture out of the offi-cers recruited as mentioned above; (ii) if so, the number of persons who were ab-sorbed in the above mentioned manner; and (iii) the reason for the aforesaid absorption? (c) If not, why? ( ) (The Hon. Dinesh Gunawardena) , , , , * . * : * : *Answer tabled : () (i) . . . (. ) 5 18-35 ( ) (ii) - 20477

asked the Prime Minister, Minister of Internal Admini-stration, and Deputy Minister of Defence, Public Security, Law and Order : (a) Is he aware that an interview was conducted on 27.05.2006 for the purpose of recruiting persons for the post of Trainee Bank Assistant of the Uva Development Bank? (b) Will he submit to this House a list of the names of candidates who appeared for the aforesaid inter-view in the order of the marks that they scored at it? (c) Will he inform this House of the names of candi-dates who have been selected for the aforesaid post? (d) Will he state the reason for not selecting Miss. Azmiya Zarook residing at No.37/8C, Hospital Road, Bandara Wevatenna, who appeared for the aforesaid interview as a candidate? (e) If not, why?
: : AIR LANKA COMPANY: GOVERNMENT TAKING OVER AGAIN 0522/'08
( - - ) (The Hon. Lakshman Nipunaarachchi - on behalf of The Hon. Anura Dissanayake ) (1) : () ? () , ? , , : ()

() , ? asked the Minister of Irrigation and Water Manage-ment and Minister of Ports and Aviation : (a) Will he state whether Air Lanka company will be taken over by the Government again after the agreement on which the manage-ment and a percentage of the shares of Air Lanka that belonged to the Government were transferred to Emirates company, has ex-pired? (b) If not why?
: GOVERNMENT LOCAL AND FOREIGN LOANS: DETAILS
( - - ) (The Hon. Lakshman Nipunaarachchi - on behalf of The Hon. Anura Dissanayake ) , , , (1) : () 2007 31 ( ) ? () (i) 2000 2007 ( ) ; (ii) ; ? () (i) 2006 2007 31 ; (ii) ; (iii) ; ? () , ? , , :
asked the Prime Minister, Minister of Internal Admini-stration and Deputy Minister of Defence, Public Security, Law and Order :

(a) Will he state the total amount of loans (including the Treasury Bills) that should be paid by the Government as at 31st March 2007, indicating local and foreign loans separetely ? (b) Will he inform this House, (i) the total amount of loans (including Treasury Bills) that has been borrowed by the Govern-ment in each of the years during the period from 2000 to 2007; and (ii) separately, the amount that was paid by the Government as interest and loan installments for local and foreign loans in each of the aforesaid years? (c) Will he submit to this House (i) the names of the institutions from which these foreign loans were borrowed during the period of year and up to 31st March 2007; (ii) separately, the amount of each of the afore-said loans;and (iii) rates of interest and other conditions followed in obtaining those loans?
( ) (The Hon. Lakshman Nipunaarachchi) , . ( ) (The Hon. Dinesh Gunawardena) , , , , . . . Question ordered to stand down.

( ) (The Hon. Ravi Karunanayake) Hon. Speaker, I want to raise a matter that concerns the Privilege of all Members of Parliament. As per the Monetary Law Act an Annual Report on the status of the economy and as per the Fiscal Management (Responsibility) Act, No. 3 of 2003 a Mid-Year Fiscal Position Report of the country have to be tabled by the 1st of June. But, none of these reports were tabled in this House by the 1st of June. Instead, on the 5th of June, the Annual Report was tabled and on the 23rd of July, the Mid-Year Fiscal Position Report was tabled. As per the Fiscal Management (Responsibility) Act, Hon. Speaker, which you and I legislated, it is necessary to inform the House of the status of the economy of the country. Because of the fact that large debts have been taken by the successive governments, it was felt necessary to bring in certain laws for the betterment of the economy. Section 3 of the Fiscal Management (Responsibility) Act ensures that the country knows exactly who is at fault in certain transactions. As per Section 5, the objective of the Fiscal Strategy Statement is to ensure that people know what is happening in the country. Then as per Section 7, the Finance Minister through the Secretary has to table a report on the budgeted income and the fiscal responsibilities. And as per section 12 (1) (a), a statement of the estimated and actual expenditure for the first four months and as per Section 12 (1) (c) a statement of the estimated and actual cash flows for the first four months shall accompany the Mid-Year Fiscal Position Report. Hon. Speaker, Section 15 deals with the Final Budget Position Report. Hon. Prime Minister, both these reports that were tabled do not contain any of the information that is required by the Act. So, what has been tabled is just a gimmick of numbers which has only misled this House because, being an Accountant, even I am unable to comprehend certain matters. Hon. Prime Minister, you also assisted in legislating the Fiscal Management (Responsibility) Act. There were some very good proposals that came from the SLFP then. Now, why is it that what is required as per the Act is not given? As you know the Supreme Court has passed strictures on the Secretary to the Ministry of Finance, Dr. P.B. Jayasundara where out of the 20 cases a referral has been made. It is this same Secretary who had prepared these two reports. Hon. Speaker, this fundamentally affects our Privileges. When public expenditure, public debt, of this country has increased over one hundred per cent over the last three years, it is absolutely essential that this House is informed of what is really going on. Sometimes, the Ministers do not know about the actual inflation factor, because they are not professionals in the field. So professionals should ensure that the Hon. Members are given the correct information. So, this again, Hon. Prime

Minister, is a misleading of Parliament by the relevant officials and I would greatly appreciate - we have a high respect for your ability in getting a job done immediately - if you ensure that the information required as per the Act is tabled in this august Assembly at the earliest. I only wanted to bring this to your notice, I do not want to make a public debate about it. And at the same time, Hon. Prime Minister, please ensure that after the reply comes from you, may be today, may be on the 5th of August, we are given a debate on this, because that is also compulsory as per the Act. Thank you. ( ) (Mr. Speaker) . . .. . 12.00 . . , [ ] .
